author: bord-at-work
text:
Isn’t the homosexual act a choice? No sin has been committed until the act takes place.

The same would go for a heterosexual person that has premarital sex. It’s still an immoral act in the eyes of god.

author: thiswaynotthatway
text: I just hope you never choose to engage in the sinful act of usury, either as the borrower of money paying interestor the lender charging it. It's still an immoral act in the eyes of god.

author: bord-at-work
text:
Interesting.

Can you please explain how this works?

Last I remember, and I may be wrong, usury was established as “sin” in the 18th century or so by papal proclamation.

The Bible has some prohibitions on usury but it was more of a way to stop loans with outrageous interest rates or that you could only charge interest rates to gentiles.

Either way this was an interesting turn, even though you were using it as a gotcha moment.

author: thiswaynotthatway
text:
The "outrageous interest" addition is the modern redefinition that is completely unsupported by scripture. There are dozens of instructions in the Bible clearly stating that you shouldn't charge interest (except *maybe* to foreigners) with never a peep about the amount.

It is a gotcha, you guys who have spent decades pretending the reason you campaign against equal rights for gay people is scriptual rather that based purely on low bigotry. The number of things you should come for before gay people if what you care about is what Yahweh wants is long. First, remove the beam out of your own eye, and then you can see clearly to remove the speck out of your brother's eye.


*Exodus 22:25* “If you lend money to any of my people with you who is poor, you shall not be like a moneylender to him, and you shall not exact interest from him.


*Ezekiel 18:13*
Lends at interest, and takes profit; shall he then live? He shall not live. He has done all these abominations; he shall surely die; his blood shall be upon himself.


*Ezekiel 18:17* Withholds his hand from iniquity, takes no interest or profit, obeys my rules, and walks in my statutes; he shall not die for his father's iniquity; he shall surely live.


*Leviticus 25:36* Take no interest from him or profit, but fear your God, that your brother may live beside you.


*Deuteronomy 23:19-20* “You shall not charge interest on loans to your brother, interest on money, interest on food, interest on anything that is lent for interest. You may charge a foreigner interest, but you may not charge your brother interest, that the Lord your God may bless you in all that you undertake in the land that you are entering to take possession of it.
